name: Orris
descriptions: Orris is a conman and bodyguard for hire operating in Freeside in 2281.

This burly Freeside local is a bodyguard known for ripping off his clients by faking attacks on them and playing the hero. Ironically, he is one of the more popular guns for hire operating in the area, paying a group of local thugs to assist in his scam. His actions have earned him hundreds of caps, much higher than the average salary of his more legitimate co-workers. This is why he has attracted the suspicion of the King.
G.I. Blues: The King asks the Courier to find out why Orris is getting more money and attention than the other bodyguards.

Upon exposing Orris as a fraud to the King, he will no longer be available for hire. The King will explain this beforehand, saying that he will send some of his men to "pull Orris off the street when no one's looking." True to his word, the bodyguard will have disappeared from Freeside's north gate, having already been caught and taken away by the Kings.

topics.response_text: Don't bother me right now. I've got to get back to see if any customers are waiting.
Nothing to worry about. If you had hired one of those other hacks, you'd be up to your ass in lowlife right about now.
So tell me, did you really think I'd be stupid enough to fall for this again? One of my men saw you go in and out of the Kings' place.

topics.topic_text: Why do I need a bodyguard crossing Freeside?
topics.response_text: Just look around. People here are as like to stab you as say hello. That is, if I weren't at your side.
Two hundred caps gets you my watchful eye for a trip to the south gate.

topics.topic_text: What if I'm not going to the south gate?
topics.response_text: Sorry, but all the people with real money are heading for the Strip, so that's the way I go. You want to go somewhere else, hire one of these losers.

topics.topic_text: I don't think I need your services. Sorry.
topics.response_text: I'm sure Freeside will disabuse you of that notion soon enough. Farewell.
Done and done. I want to mention a few things up front. In order to ensure your safety, I need you to follow my instructions to the letter.

topics.topic_text: Two hundred caps! That's twice what everyone else is charging!
topics.response_text: Hey, you want the best, you have to pay for it.

topics.topic_text: Hey you only fired three shots and there are four guys there...
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Er, noticed that, did you? I keenly aimed one of the shots through some soft tissue of one of them to hit the man behind him.

topics.topic_text: Why did you run ahead like that?
topics.response_text: Call it a hunch. You do this job for long enough, and you learn to trust your instincts.
My thoughts exactly. Time is money, after all.

topics.topic_text: Or, you just faked this whole thing to drum up repeat business.
topics.response_text: That's an interesting theory you've got there. I'd suggest you keep it to yourself. Let's get moving.
Stay close. I wouldn't want something to happen to you.

topics.topic_text: I want all the money you have on you. I could make it to the Kings from here.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I ought to take my chances and kill you right here, but you may be right. Here, take this.

topics.topic_text: I don't have that kind of money.
topics.response_text: You want the best, you have to be prepared to pay for it.

conversation.response_text: To your left here is the Old Mormon Fort. You get roughed up, the Followers there will patch you right up. Not that I ever need their services.
Up ahead on the next block is where the Kings hang out. Don't let them scare you, if they don't outnumber you five to one you'll be fine.
Down to the right here is the fun part of town. You haven't seen Freeside till you've been to the Wrangler.
It's regrettable, but it looks like I'm about to lose another customer.
You idiot! What part of "play dead" do you not understand?
Well, here we are. No worse for wear, are you? I trust that if you need to cross Freeside again, you'll know who to hire.
That was rather invigorating, wasn't it? Let's keep moving, it's only a little further to the gate.
Gotcha! Thought you could ambush us, huh?
Just so you know, heading out here breaks our contract. This is why I ask people to pay up front. See you around.
Hmmm, I guess they were harmless after all. I'm not often mistaken, you know.
I'll scout ahead. You follow at a distance.
Hey, slow down. I don't like the look of some of those men ahead. Let's take a different way around.
